description: Every time I close the app I loose all my notes. I tried many times to open Notable, type something and close it again but every time all the notes go blank.
summary: Does not save the note when closing the app

description: Dont even try this app as this doesn't store your notes in the drive. Totally waste of time

This app is very similar to Joplin (https://joplinapp.org/), though I am not sure whether it can synchronise with cloud like Joplin.

BUG: Add attachment doesn't work properly, needs more work.
summary: Nice "Near Replica" of Joplin, slightly buggy on Ubuntu 20.04

description: I don't have any notes lost as ones have mentioned earlier. Light, easy to use and nice looking (md synthax) notes.
Yet another markdown editor with OK interface. Unfortunately, it does not work on Wayland.

This is a fantastic little program. Love the markdown functionality. Clean. Efficient. Light. Simple. I'll be uninstalling Simplenote. I see a lot of bad comments. I am using Ubuntu 20.04. For me it is working fine.
This is the best note taking app I ever used. The bugs mentioned in March are long gone and I would really recommend you guys to try it, better if downloading directly from its web. Good luck!
summary: Give it a bit of time, continuous updates and very active development

description: Great app to organize my notes. It has all the features I need. Definetly recommend!
Doesn't open on a Ununbu 20.04 Fresh Install.

Simple and stylish app for taking notes.
I had the problem that every time I was closing the app I was loosing all my notes: to fix it just change the data directory: "Notable" > "Change Data Directory..."
summary: Finally a nice app for taking notes!

description: Nice app for taking quick notes

Opened it.. Ubuntu 20.04 .. no prob. Wrote short not that I don't care if I lose it.. and quit! Daa Daa Daaa! I opened it again..... suspenseful pause... My useless note was,,,, There! Yay..
Hey.. I left out the part where it asks where you want to store your notes when you first run it.. I bet most, or all.. of the people who this didn't work for either put something totally bogus.. or like /etc (aka: some random place that's not writable) Personally, I just picked the suggested location.. when it asked, and even opened the ~ directory, I created a directory called .notable (that's what it suggested) and selected it. So far so good.. maybe I'll even try it.. seems fine. Maybe the directions have to be really explicit for those who are trying Linux for the first time and don't know that everything isn't explained to you letter by letter like windows... they spend WAY more time on documenting the software, and enhancing it, than the Ever did fixing bugs, including the new ones in the enhancements they have to add... or else... if they just fixed it... people would have no reason to buy a new version!  :-(
summary: I always love to try ones where a bunch say "doesn't work" etc.

description: You can only export notes as pdf once, if you try it agin with another note, everything freezes. I liked the easy to use simple interface, but it is not worth it.
summary: Laptop (ubuntu) hangs on multiple export as pdf
